message.content:
<<<api>>>: Workbook, Sheet
<<<code>>>: for (File file : listOfFiles){
  if (file.isFile() && (file.getName().substring(file.getName().lastIndexOf('.')+1).equals("xlsx"))){
    Workbook workbook = WorkbookFactory.create(file.getAbsoluteFile());
    Sheet sheet = workbook.getSheetAt(0);
    int j = sheet.getLastRowNum();
    System.out.println(j);
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: Your code is correctly iterating through all the files in the folder and checking if they are xlsx files. However, you are getting the lastRowNum() for each sheet in each file, which is why you are getting the sum of all values in all files. To get the lastRowNum() for the first sheet only, you can use the getSheetAt(0) method to get the first sheet in each file.
